audio_caption: The audio clip begins with an upbeat, rhythmic tune characteristic of a pop music genre, creating a lively and energetic mood. A female voice then takes over, speaking in an enthusiastic tone, introducing a show called "Tea Time Unfiltered" and its host, Lovely Tea. The speaker states that the show will focus on trending topics on social media, directing listeners to the show's Instagram handle. The speaker concludes with "Hey, you guys".

The audio begins with an energetic, upbeat female speaker welcoming listeners to a podcast episode called "Tea Time Unfiltered" hosted by "your girl Lovely T". She announces the episode will focus on "these two", whom she identifies as Elijah Rain and rapper Future Hendrix, classifying it as an official Dragon Ball T episode on her YouTube channel and podcast. The speaker then outlines the situation, before the audio ends abruptly with a short cheering sound, which is presumably unrelated to the rest of the audio.

The audio begins with a female speaker discussing a situation involving "these fools" and "Eliza Reign", mentioning she "purposefully getting knocked up by Future". The tone is conversational. She mentions this happened "about a year and a half ago". She summarizes the situation, starting with "so, what's going down is this".

The audio clip begins with a single, confident female voice explaining how a group of women, the mothers of Future's children, joined forces to do DNA tests, as the rapper refused. The tone is somewhat sassy and incredulous. The speaker then, in a mock "Maury" voice, humorously declares, "You are the damn father Future."  The speaker then notes that the DNA test results have now been used in court against him.

The audio clip starts with a single female speaker discussing how a rapper is being sued after DNA tests confirmed he fathered a child, with the speaker highlighting that the woman is suing him for libel, slander, and emotional distress, as well as publicly calling her crazy, a gold digger, and threatening to kill her if she did not have an abortion, mentioning she is definitely looking for some money. The speaker's tone is gossipy and informative.

The audio clip features a sole female speaker relaying a story with an energetic and opinionated tone. She talks about how after a story broke online regarding Eliza Reign suing someone, Future, who she claims doesn't have much room to talk, got his feelings hurt and basically called Eliza Reign ugly. She then continues describing a situation where Future makes comments about "ugly girls" and their relationships, including derogatory remarks regarding someone else’s looks. Throughout the speech, there’s occasional laughter from the speaker adding a touch of lightheartedness despite the negative nature of the topics discussed.

The clip starts with a woman saying "future to me is very plain" in a conversational tone. She says she's never "lusted over Future," and the only thing she likes about him is "his height and maybe his dreadlocks." Then, she narrates that Eliza Rain was clowned by her baby's father, who called her "ugly." Eliza responded by "go[ing] to Instagram and rant[ing]." Eliza is quoted saying, "In all seriousness as women we must stick together." She says, "we all are beautiful, even when we fall short of other people's expectations. Beauty is shown the best from the inside." The woman adds more of what Eliza Rain said, like "War is not cute," and she wants to defend herself and her children.

The audio clip begins with a single female speaker delivering a serious message, emphasizing the need for women to reject abuse and silence, stating "we are stronger than we know". She identifies herself as Eliza Rain. Following this, the speaker changes her tone, adopting a more casual, conversational approach saying "let's keep it real" to state she does not feel bad for Eliza Rain.

The audio clip begins with an angry-sounding female speaker passionately describing someone named "Eliza Reign" as a "messy ass chick" who has been "messy and miserable" from the start and "done way too much" seeking attention. The speaker notes "the worst part of it all" is that she knew the man had children he "wasn't claiming".

The audio begins with a woman speaking in an assertive tone about someone watching "Joey Chavez go through it" and "Britney Malle" and other women before her, "only for her to have no problem purposely getting pregnant" and having his sixth or seventh child. She then accuses her of "wanting to play victim" when she "knew the type of guy" she was getting into a relationship with. The speaker emphasizes that both parties are guilty, and the main person affected is a little girl, their daughter, who didn't ask to be here.

The clip starts with a female speaker saying, "Now, let's keep it real." She acknowledges that some people are offended by comments made about Future's baby mama being ugly, stating, "Future is not the first person to say this." Her tone is conversational and somewhat opinionated as she speaks about social media and Future. She says, "I feel like this is the real reason why Future is dragging her," and adds, "You know, let's keep it real, social media has been coining her the ugly baby mama."

The audio clip begins with a female speaker addressing "all the future baby mamas," mentioning how "a lot of people on social media have always drugged Eliza Reign's looks." She notes her body and potential cosmetic enhancements, stating people have talked about her face both positively and negatively, particularly on social media. The speaker asserts she's "keeping it 100" and then indicates how she really feels about the situation.

The audio clip features a single female speaker, adopting a critical and somewhat indignant tone. She speculates that a man, referred to as "Elijah Reign", would not have reacted as strongly to a woman's rejection if she had looked like several other women mentioned by name. She references moments where the speaker was "dragged" by Joey and Britney, but claims they were never referred to as ugly, deeming this "very suspect."

The audio clip begins with a female speaker sharing her opinion, saying she feels "future has a distaste for her, because she's a dark skinned woman." Her tone is impassioned and opinionated, as she elaborates on her belief that Future intentionally avoids using condoms because he doesn't deem some women worthy of being the mother of his child. She then becomes more emphatic, stating that if he doesn't respect the women, he doesn't respect himself and he doesn't respect his own sperm. Her tone turns accusatory, and she accuses Future of being careless by having multiple children with different women in a short period. She exclaims that all of his female partners are lucky that they didn't get an STD. The clip ends with the speaker indicating that she'll be moving on.

The audio clip starts with speech, in which a woman expresses her opinion about Future's preferences. Her tone is assertive and she mentions that he doesn't care about the number of baby mothers he has as long as they fit social media's standards of attractiveness. The speech concludes with an emphasized "Okay?" and a question.

The audio clip begins with a single female speaker discussing the way Future treats Lori Harvey, describing him "dropping roses at her feet". She transitions to discussing Future's behavior towards women who look like "Joie or Lori" in his songs, stating "he's never talked bad".

The audio begins with a female speaker discussing a public figure's past relationships and criticizing inconsistencies in his treatment of former partners, referencing that one was "just as messy". The tone is critical. Background music featuring a hip-hop style with upbeat mood and discernible beat plays softly in the background, enhancing the podcast feel. This is followed by sounds of water splatters and a child's laughter mixed with some speech. The audio transitions back to the female speaker who promotes podcast availability on platforms like Apple Podcast and Spotify. A final sound of glass shattering concludes the clip.
